hackathon-description-text: is an opportunity for young makers to collaborate together on innovative projects with the guidance of experienced tech mentors. This hackathon will be a weekend long event that will end with all teams presenting their products to a panel of judges and a public audience for review and feedback. The chosen winning teams will be based on multiple prize tracks including: Hardware, Software and Fan Favorite.

hackathon-judges.judge-role: Director at the Maryland Out of School Time (MOST) Network

hackathon-requirements:
:
Software includes video games and web projects.
hackathon-rules:
The goal of this event is for youth to explore the hackathon environment in a safe and friendly way. Remember, there are lots of different 
 throughout the weekend. Here are some examples:

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: The team that places first in the software category will receive $500.
The team that places first in the hardware category will receive $500.

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=1045 Light St, Baltimore, MD 21230, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion:
Did you challenge yourself?
What new skills did you learn?

Did you communicate with each other?
How well did the team communicate with the judges?

Does the project function as intended? 
What is the level of completeness?
How does the output compare to what the team envisioned?

hackathon-description-header: Digital Harbor Foundation’s very own youth steering committee organized one of the first hackathons for youth, planned by youth.
